Detailed Description

Core functions file.

This file provides core functions used by Boo.

License:
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
Link:
http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework
Copyright:
2008 David Singer
Author:
David Singer <david@ramaboo.com>
Version:
2.0.1

br ( $  count = 2,
$  return = false 
)

Returns a HTML break.

This function is usefull for quickly outputing breaks for testing.

Parameters:
int $count[optional] The number of breaks to return.
bool $return[optional] Set to TRUE to return output, FALSE to print.
Returns:
string HTML breaks. Will echo if $return is set to FALSE.

get_uptime (  ) 

Returns uptime on a unix system.

The output format is D HH:MM:SS or HH:MM:SS if day is 0.

Returns:
string The uptime.

$  word,
$  caseSensitive = true 
)

Returns a string with words removed from the begining.

Removes all proceding whitespace as well.

Returns:
string Returns string without word if found, original string otherwise.
Parameters:
string $str The string to manipulate.
string $word The word to remove.
bool $caseSensitive[optional] Use case sensitive searching.

$  index,
$  direction 
)

Moves an element within an array.

Parameters:
array $array The array.
int $index The item to move.
mixed $direction The direction to move the item as a positive or negative integer. The words "up" or "down" may also be used.
Returns:
mixed The array on success, or FALSE on failure.
Warning:
Only works on numerically indexed arrays.

$  word,
$  caseSensitive = true 
)

Un-quotes a quoted string recursivly.

Returns:
mixed Returns Un-quoted string or array.
Parameters:
mixed $value The input string or array. Returns a string with words removed from the end. Removes all trailing whitespace as well.
Returns:
string Returns string without word if found, original string otherwise.
Parameters:
string $str The string to manipulate.
string $word The word to remove.
bool $caseSensitive[optional] Use case sensitive searching.

Makes sure running scripts is allowed.

Set BOO_ALLOW_SCRIPTS to TRUE in your config file to allow scripts.

Returns:
mixed Returns TRUE if allowed, exits otherwise.

Definition at line 282 of file core.php.

Makes sure running tests is allowed.

Set BOO_ALLOW_TESTS to TRUE in your config file to allow tests.

Returns:
mixed Returns TRUE if allowed, exits otherwise.

Definition at line 297 of file core.php.

strtodb ( $  string  ) 

Formats string for insertion into database.

This function does not check for SQL injections. By default this function is identical to strtolower().

If you wish to preserve capitalization in your database or use another capitalization schema then edit this function.

Only some strings are passed though this function. For example a users first name would be however the state code would not (its always uppercase).

Parameters:
string $string The string to format
Returns:
string Returns the string in database format (default is lowercase).

Definition at line 328 of file core.php.

Referenced by Boo_User::setApartmentNumber(), Boo_User::setCity(), Boo_User::setCompany(), Boo_Group::setDescription(), Boo_User::setFirstName(), Boo_User::setLastName(), Boo_Group::setName(), and Boo_User::setStreet().

truncate ( $  text,
$  length,
$  etc = '...' 
)

Truncates a string to a given length.

If the string ends in a punctuation mark then it is removed before applying $etc.

Punctuation marks include [.!?:;,-] and the space character.

Parameters:
string $text The text to truncate.
int $length The length to truncate to.
string $etc[optional] Addition to the string after truncating. Defaults to ellipsis.
Returns:
string Returns truncated string plus addition if supplied.
